data.text: @GrumpyGamersPod Thanks for the magic-selection, more for the backlog. 😅 Hellblade was scary fir me. 😱
@GrumpyGamersPod I don't think I could cope with Alien Isolation, it looked so scary. I'd need a 10hr animal crossing session afterwards to feel safe again.

@Metallijohn 😂😂😂 I love the “to be extra safe”. 

I’ve always loved scary games as well, however if #RE7 scared you, maybe stay away from Alien: Isolation. That is honestly the closest I’ve gotten in recent years to freaking out playing a game lol.

@GrumpyGamersPod Condemned was such a good game, the department store level was bloody terrifying. 

I love horror movies and novels but I struggle with horror games because I sometimes find them too scary, RE7 nearly gave me a panic attack, I turned it off and uninstalled it to be extra safe lol

@Metallijohn I’ll join you on that, John. We can take that journey together. 

My want to play is inspired by the show as I’m just catching up with it, so will be interesting to see what all fuss is about.

@GrumpyGamersPod I've tried to play it 4 times now, I always get about 5 hours in and just bounce off it. I love the books, I love fantasy and rpgs, it should be my perfect game. I'll try it again when the upgrade comes out because I really want to love it.
@GrumpyGamersPod Eddie trying to decipher if he's been insulted or not is the perfect start to any day.

@Metallijohn You’re not alone! 

I’ve never even played #TheWitcher which is sacrilege in its own right! Haha!
@GrumpyGamersPod No worries, cheers for answering my question, I thought I was the only rpg fan in the world that didn't get on with The Witcher 3, I also bought it multiple times lol.
Sorry @Metallijohn! Messed up your tag. Can’t trust me to do anything right.
